alert.note: Alert for Northern Franklin; Western Clinton (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 01 at 3:20AM EDT until April 01 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 8 AM THIS MORNING TO 4 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. * WHERE...Northern Franklin and Western Clinton Counties. * WHEN...From 8 AM this morning to 4 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may result. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Downslope wind gusts will develop this morning into the early afternoon along the northern Adirondacks, including Malone, New York. This could produce strong crosswinds along the extent of Route 11 in Franklin and western Clinton Counties of New York.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
